name: MIT Student
objective: To pursue a career in biomedical research and education with a focus on innovation and community impact.
summary: This resume highlights MIT student Adriana Smithfield's academic background, research experience, and commitment to advancing biomedical sciences and women's health.

education.degree: Visit to Sabancı University in Istanbul (2014)
Achieved Grande Distinction during foreign exchange in French-speaking Belgium
Six week foreign exchange in Röhrnbach, Germany (Summer 2009)

experience.description: Created platform for biosensor development based on B-cell receptor, awarded provisional patent, presented poster at 2015 BioMAN Summit, and advisor for MIT iGEM 2015 team.
Investigated role of Sur8 in nucleus, analyzed proteomics and microarray data, and shared research through presentations.
Developed genetic circuit for Alzheimer’s disease detection and treatment, shared research, and received a gold medal.
Generated and purified VHH fragments against glycolytic enzymes, assessed effects of VHH fragments on enzyme function.
Studied cancer pathology, radiation treatment, and space microbiology.

projects.title: SPLASH Underserved Student Recruiter and Teacher
projects.description: Communicated with primary contacts at various low-income high schools in the Bay Area to draw hundreds of students to attend Fall SPLASH 2012. Assisted in the logistics planning as a member of the administration team. Taught classes on the biology and historical context of lactose intolerance.

projects.title: ThinkMath Instructor, Trainer, and Assistant Team Lead
projects.description: Taught elementary school students from a Singaporean math curriculum. Led training sessions for new ThinkMath instructors about lesson planning and teaching techniques. Organized placement results for students and communicated with parents.

skills: Laboratory Techniques : Cloning, SDS-PAGE/Western blot, mammalian tissue culture, transient transfection, protein purification
Programming : Familiarity with MATLAB, Python, and Java
Languages : English (native), French (fluent), Spanish (fluent), German (basic), Portuguese (basic)
Leadership & Service : Stop Our Silence President, Co-President, Treasurer, and roles in mentorship programs.
